headline: Kim's Gingerbread Cookies
description: This gingerbread cookie recipe looks complicated, but it is actually pretty easy. I have used this recipe for many years and always get compliments on it.

video.description: See how to make simple, 5-star gingerbread cookies.
video.name: Gingerbread Cookies II

name: Kim's Gingerbread Cookies
recipeIngredient: 1 cup shortening, melted and cooled slightly

recipeInstructions.text: Sift together flour, baking powder, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, and cinnamon in a large bowl.

In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat shortening, molasses, brown sugar, water, egg, and vanilla until smooth and creamy, 3 to 4 minutes. Gradually mix in the dry ingredients until fully incorporated. Divide dough into thirds; form each piece into a 1 1/2-inch-thich disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 3 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Working with one disk at a time, roll the dough on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of 1/4 inch. Cut into desired shapes with cookie cutters. Place cookies 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets.

Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, switching racks halfway through. When the cookies are done, they will look dry, but still be soft to the touch. Remove from the baking sheet to cool on wire racks.

review.reviewBody: Best gingerbread man recipe I have ever made
Taste awful, no flavor

i followed the recipe EXACTLY, but they were so sticky they could not be rolled out. Ended out rolling them in 1 inch balls, slightly flattened and baked. I then decorated them as gingerbread heads. Kind of amusing but will not bother with this recipe again
Left them in the oven a little less time than indicated and they were delicious. Used Royal icing to ice them. Delightful and yummy
Great recipe! First time I made gingerbread cookies and these were perfect. I will definitely be making these every year.

This recipe would be ideal for pieces for a gingerbread house. The baked cookies are very firm and will not crack or bend with lots of toppings. 
However, I wanted a tasty, spicy, chewy gingerbread cookie and this was not it.

I just was looking for a cookie recipe at first. But then I saw a lot more exciting foods to cook. For the holidays and for just after school, home from work quick and easy meals. And now I am hooked. And on those Sundays after church meals are even better. They have recipes for everyone q
Not as spicy as the last recipe I used, but mild enough for the kids to still enjoy!
First time ever making gingerbread men. It's actually easier than the butter cookies recipe that has been passed down in the family. Didn't change a thing and they are very delicious.
Nice and solid on outside, and good chew on inside. Have made this with children for years.
Best recipe! They are soft and delicious and I will never use another recipe!
Excellent recipe! Rolls and cuts nicely.
I have used this recipe a lot! So, yes I will use it again. I did add a touch of allspice and they still turned out really good.

I have always loved my sister and mother's gingerbread cookies so I decided to make them for myself this year. First time for gingerbread and I couldn't be happier. I love this recipe! Very easy to follow and very easy to make. Thank you and Merry Christmas!!!

I followed the recipe almost exactly. The only two things I changed were adding extra ginger and decreasing molasses to 3/4 c. MY cookies needed sugar which is probably why some people said they taste like dog biscuits. I’m not sure why 6 cups of four is needed because other recipes use 3 cups. This recipe might be palatable if you play with the measurements. I would add sugar or decrease the flour but it needs work.
ESier than I thought, came out good. Grandkids decorated n ate em.
This recipe is my go to. Always easy to roll and use for cookies and houses!

I couldnt find MY (written) recipe so in a pinch I made this as stated and added orange zest. The raw batter was okay but not six dozen blah cookies! Ugh! ...dog biscuit reject! Their saving grace by my peppermint buttercream frosting and a holy ton of sugar sprinkles.

This recipe is terrible. I made this exactly as called for. The cookies came out nice and soft, but were unedible. The taste was purely molasses. I then made cream cheese icing to try and make it better but that didn't work. I just wasted so much time
This is the best homemade gingerbread cookies I've ever tasted.
These are a classic in my family, so good.
First time ever making them! Super easy recipe. And the kids love them
no changes it was great!!
I tried this recipe twice. Dough was so dry and crumbly. I'll find another recipe.
I doubled the cinnamon and cut back on the cloves and they were the best gingerbread cookies I have ever had!
Followed the recipe exactly. I did not like gingerbread cookies before, and this recipe converted me. Delicious.
This recipe was so disappointing. There was no flavor and the texture was horrible. I had to start completely over with a different recipe on Christmas Eve. I hope nobody makes the same mistake.

I used butter in place of shortening and removed the cloves because cloves tend to be over powering to me. Thanks for the recipe :) I also increased to cinnamon like previous reviewers.... but that might just be a me thing because my family LOVES cinnamon.

This recipe was easy to follow, but not very flavorful. When eating a gingerbread cookie I expect a bold, rich, flavor of Ginger and Cinnamon. This had neither of those flavors...all I tasted was flour. I don't think I'll be using this recipe again and I know I definitely won't be giving away these cookies as Christmas gifts as intended. If you like bland cookies, then this recipe is for you.

I used butter instead of shortening and 
1/2 c. molasses & 1/2 c. honey instead of a whole c. molasses
They were soft and tasty.
I didn’t make any changes to the recipe, it was delicious. I might add a little more spice next time. My grandchildren loved them.

Awful. Dry and chalky with very little flavor. A waste of a lot of ingredients. After tasting the first batch, I turned the rest into shapes for a gingerbread house, since no one eats those anyway. The dough was fun to play with and easy to work, but that's the ONLY good thing about these cardboard like "cookies".
Too much cloves and the dough is dry. Also increased cooking time to 20 minutes

I made the recipe, swapping out 50/50 coconut oil/butter mixture.( I didn’t have shortening on hand.) for rolling out and cutting, this dough is very easy to work with. 

Taste is OK. I think I’d put more ginger, maybe even sugar (which I almost never want more of). I think if I ice it, it’ll be better. As far as eating, it’s not my favorite. I was hoping for more of a butter cookie texture, these were very solid, but not in a crispy sweet way. B/c of the texture, I think this may work GREAT for building.
We made a GIANT gingerbread cookie with this recipe and it was delicious!
My kids enjoyed making their holiday gingerbread boys and girls. Would make again. W

Best gingerbread cookie recipe ever! 
I used real butter instead of shortening which made the moist! I will continue using this in years to come!!!
Most requested cookie from my grandchildren..it's a winner..Just follow as is. Do not change anything.
Everyone said it was the best and most authentic GingerBREAD cookies they have ever tasted!
Loved these. I took the suggestion about using butter in place of 1/2 the shortening and used extra spices for a more flavorful cookie.
This was horrible! I don't know what happened, but they came out hard as a rock! They also did not taste very great... They lacked sugar and all I could taste was molasses. Do not recommend

Great Recipe! The only thing I would suggest is rolling out the cookie dough between plastic wrap. Adding flour to roll the dough leaves the white flour on your pretty brown dough! Thank you for the recipe! Merry Christmas Everyone!! Have a Happy, Healthy New Year!

About 20 years ago I had this recipe and lost it to a hard drive crash. I've been looking for it ever since and I am so pleased to have found it! The dough is amazing; shiny, malleable, soft... like millionaire's play dough lol When you bake it, not only does it not spread, it holds lovely detail for formed or sculpted cookies. The taste is homestyle and the bite is soft. I really like this recipe. :)
I found my "dough" turned out much too crumbly. It is suggested to add water only 1tbs at a time, though I ended up doing it 1/3 of a cup at a time. Afterward it all turned out great! :)

Wonderful recipe, I did make some changes though. Instead of molasses I used honey. I also used allspice instead of cloves and canola oil instead of shortening. Worked great. I made it for family and friends and had to make more.
they did not taste like Gingerbread cookies ruin My Christmas . Will never make these again
Mine were not very flavorful, and I really didn't like the taste.

I followed this recipe exactly. I refrigerated the dough overnight as I didn't have time the day before. Maybe that's why my dough crumbled after I took it out of the fridge. Got about 12 cookies out of the crumbled dough and they look terrible. Lots of cracks!! I won't make this recipe again!!!

Great texture. Beginner friendly. 
The only thing I would change is double the amounts of cinnamon and nutmeg. I bake a lot. I felt everything else was spot on. DO NOT CUT DOWN THE MOLASSES, use a full cup. (1 cup) 
I would definitely recommend this recipe.
These were delicious.... hubby approved! I substituted the shortening for butter as that's all I had on hand. Will definitely make again!

I made the cookies exactly as per the recipe (exact American cup sizes) set the oven temp to 20c lower then in recipe as using a fan oven. They only need 10 minutes as 12 will make them harder. They are perfect to ice or leave as is. I did not cut back on any ingredients or make changes. They turn out soft and puffy, but keep their shape well. They remind me of the German gingerbread. I think for any body leaving a negative review it could be because you are not using the correct measures....With regards to the dough being crumbly you need to make sure you have a cool work surface, you need to work at a medium pace so the dough has time to adjust to room temperature (slightly) but not so much that it gets soft. The oven needs to be set to the correct temperature (adjust for fan assisted) and do not substitute as that is when things go wrong...
I will never make again. The taste after baking was awful. I would not recommend this recipe.

This recipe was great! But I did change it a little. I would recommend replacing the nutmeg and ground cloves with 1 Tbs pumpkin pie spice. The only problem I have with these cookies is that they are not quite as crisp as I was hoping, but still, I would totally make it again!
I did not make any changes. The people I made it for said they were wonderful, its the way they are to taste.
This recipe is WAY TOO DRY. It came out just crumbly. I added 1/3 cup more liquid which made it quite gummy. Also the flavour was weak. Not enough ginger.

Made with my daughters and it was so easy. Used the suggested change of 1 Tbsp cinnamon and I used wheat flour for half the flour and did not reduce the molasses. Instead of icing them, I let the girls put crystal sugar sprinkles on them before baking. They are perfect and so delicious! Next time, and there will be a next time soon, I will roll out some a little thinner. I like a crispier cookie with my tea!
I make this recipe exactly as stated and my kids love eating them. My mother makes a similar recipe and states if you want a sweeter cookie to use sorghum instead.
My girlfriend and me made this recipe and give out Xmas cookies as gifts, everybody said the cookies where so good. We didn't find molasses and use honey instead, it work out just fine. Thanks!

These cookies are freaking FABULOUS! I made these for Christmas gifts and I have never had so much feedback as I have with any other cookie. Everybody said they were the best Gingerbread cookies they have ever had. Keeping this recipe and I am going to make some for me!

I should have followed the original recipe and put in the whole cup of molasses as with only 3/4 cup it wasn't sweet enough for my likes. It did roll out nice and I used the suggestions of others to increase spices which I am glad I did. Next year, I will keep the molasses where it should be and you should too to avoid cardboard comparisons.

I did as other reviewers stated and decreased the molasses to 3/4 c and doubled the cinnamon, omitted the cloves, and added a teaspoon of allspice. These were incredibly difficult to roll out unless warmed up a bit, and even then, not ideal. You have to be extremely gentle with it while rolling or it crumbles. They came out dry and tasteless and I was very careful while rolling out not to incorporate too much flour. Tried rolling out between wax paper sheets and that was worse, it stuck to the paper even when straight out of the fridge. I will return to my mother's recipe and probably not make these again. Lacking flavor and moisture.

I have never written a review for a recipe before, but am so frustrated with this one that I want to warn others against using this recipe. I am very glad I halved the recipe so did not waste even more ingredients. It was impossible to roll out, and the cookies ended up tasting like cardboard, with a little shortening and molasses. Ugh, wasted so much time on these!
The dough looked great but the molasses over powdered everything I would definitely cut back. The flavor was weak also.
I though the dough looked the write consistency but in the end they turned out more like muffins. Not impressed.

i made the recipe as is. definately too much molasses. has a very strong spice taste. some people may love it but i prefer gingerbread to be more of a subtle taste. could be improved with some adjustments but for whats its worth i'd just try something else
Really dry & Very spicey tasting. Needed a little extra sugar or cut down on the amount of spices. I would replace the shortening with butter maybe?

If you want a cookie that isn't too strong then this is an okay recipe. I however, prefer more flavor and to me these were just bland - thats after I added twice as much cinammon and extra cloves. In my opinion the amount of ginger should probably be doubled. I also added a tablespoon of orange rind which is probably the only thing that saved them from being tossed... I also ended up covering them in a glaze with ginger sprinkled over the top in an attempt to get more flavor out of them. The recipe was easy to make though and the dough was very nice to work with, and didn't have much spread so your gingerbread men wont lose their shape! Ill still be finding a different recipe next time!
I always use real butter in place of shortening and these turned out great! I also used 1.5 tablespoons of ginger because I just love it. :)
They have a very strong aftertaste.
Be carefup. The dough was so thick it broke my mixer!
Looked and smelled great.

I love this recipe! It makes sooooo many cookies that I split it in half (even the egg!) but I've made it exactly like this several times and loved it every time. Icing keeps the cookies at the perfect spice-sweet balance!

Sorry but this turned out to be the worst ginger cookies ever in my household. Cinnamon must be at least tripled in the recipe as others did. I would have actually also put a bit more molasses in it too. I found the texture extremely hard, usually it is much easier to work with. The color was white when I took it out from the oven and not the typical darker gingerman colour.
ThSee were perfect the whole family loved them.
It was really good!!!!!
I have made this recipe as written and made it with half the spices for my preschool class. Both ways they are fantastic cookies.
These cookies were really easy to work with and the recipe made a ton of cookies! However there wasn't as much flavor as I was hoping them to have. I won't be making these again.
I don't usually post a negative review, but save your money and effort. These are great for decorating the tree with, as the hold together nicely, but they taste terrible!

I just finished the dough and put it in the refrigerator for the asked three hours and now I am reading the reviews and I am apprehensive, because they are so mixed. I hope they turn out good because it is the 23rd and I am planning to bring these as a hostess present for tomorrow. I didn't change anything with the recipe. Now I am making some icing to decorate them. It is 23:15 and they really better turn out great because I won't have time to make another batch.

2:45am; I only kept the dough refrigerated for 1h30. They turned out really great. I made some royal icing and with or without the icing they taste great. Yeah!!! However 12 minutes is too long; I kind of overcooked the first batch. but the ones after were good.
Tasted awful and the dough was hard to work with, very disappointing.

Yummy. Only 14 years old and I made this work. I was scared that they wouldn't be good because of the other reviews but I think it's better with 3/4 of molasses it's just perfect :) and decorated them after. It takes time but we need patience right? Anyways amazing cookies :)

This recipe is great, but I suggest cutting it in half. I'm drowning in cookies. I gave half of them to my mom and she had to get rid of them by giving it to her friends and then she had to bury them in the backyard. It never ends. Every time I think I have eaten the last cookie, 10 more appear.
I used 1 Tbsp cinnamon instead of 1 tsp. I left out cloves. I used 3/4 c molasses instead of 1 cup and added 1/4 c dark corn syrup plus an extra 1/4 c brown sugar.

I mean no disrespect, but these are the worst gingerbread cookies we have ever tasted. We followed the recipes exactly. We were hoping to make a delicious holiday treat as a family activity, but we will try a different recipe tomorrow. If you don't like the taste or smell of food made with shortening, then avoid this recipe.

I tried this recipe yesterday and I followed the recipe instead of others tweeks thinking that I should try as written before changing. The dough was easy to work with but wouldn't let me roll out more than 3x and the cookies were kind of bland and boring. I will say that if I do decide to try it again I will definitely up the spices as others suggest. I used a whole cup Molasses because you can't over do it and I thought it might keep them more moist.
Make sure to roll them really thin & add a lot more spices!
The whole thing tastes like molasses. I was so disappointed. I don't know what I did wrong but I followed everything perfectly on the directions. NOT WORTH IT.
This was a great gingerbread recipe! Soft and chewy and very tasty with icing!

I made only 1/2 of this recipe. I subbed 3/8 cups of molasses instead of 1/2 cups. I doubled the cinnamon and ginger, and only refrigerated the dough for an hour or so. I subbed in butter for shortening and baked at 180C. They turned out really well.
This was by far the most disappointing recipe ever!!!!! ... it was dry and tasted bland.. the texture was almost like cardboard
I baked these cookies today but did not care for the flavor. I think there was too much mollassses. The dough itself was very easy to work with. I will not make this recipe again
Tasteless
its amazing!

It is a very delicious cookie! I made them today. The only thing I don't like is that you need icing! It is very dry, and hard to eat by it's self. I like this because it is soft and very tasty, and it only takes 10-12 minutes! Overall very good recipe!

I made these cookies this a.m. Christmas Eve 2012, the dough is perfect for soft cookies. I grated fresh ginger into the recipe to add a little bite but next year I will also add more sugar. I also added a tbsp of orange juice. My husband, the gingerbread cookie lover in the family likes them a lot but thinks they should be a little sweeter. I read some reviews that said there was too much molasses, that is funny because my husband asked me if I had put any in them. Definitely a keeper recipe. Now to ice them!

The texture was great-- soft almost like cake which I love. But the sweetness was lacking and could've used a little salt. I was surprised at how soft the dough was, but was very pleased with how easily it rolled out and cut. So add about 1/2 tsp salt and up the sugar just a dash and this would definitely be a winner. I will make it again with modifications.

I changed the amount of servings to 36. and it was a mess.
The dough was pitch black, so I had to add about 130g more of flour, but the bitterness of the molasses wouldn't go away. I even reduced 120mL to 90mL. What did I do wrong??!!?!? But again, it was probably me that made the mistake. Thankyou for the recipe! I'll have to try again somtime.

I read many reviews first before making these cookies. I halved the recipe since 6 cups of flour seemed like a lot of cookies & used 1/3 c oj instead of water and used a whole egg. I also used half shortening and half butter. I didn't refrigerate the dough which didn't seem to matter. My cookies were nice and soft. I did find them a bit bland. I remade the cookies as above and doubled the spices (tripled the cinnamon)-much better tasting!

Great Recipe! i even used 1 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon :-)
PS: Due to unavailability of some ingredients in my country, i replaced the shortening with unslated butter and the molasses with melted sugar*.
I melted 1 cup of sugar with drops of lemon juice and continuous stirring.
